meanings.definition: Make less severe, serious, or painful.
meanings.sent1: She tried to mitigate the pain by taking a painkiller.
meanings.sent2: The doctor prescribed medication to mitigate the patient's symptoms.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to mitigate the seriousness of the situation by cracking a joke.
meanings.sent4: Her smile acted as a balm to mitigate the severity of the news.
meanings.sent5: The soothing music helped mitigate the discomfort during the procedure.

meanings.definition: Lessen the impact or intensity of.
meanings.sent1: Planting trees can help mitigate the effects of climate change.
meanings.sent2: The new policy aims to mitigate the risks associated with the project.
meanings.sent3: His quick thinking helped mitigate the impact of the mistake.
meanings.sent4: The umbrella could only do so much to mitigate the force of the storm.
meanings.sent5: Regular exercise can mitigate the negative effects of a sedentary lifestyle.
